intro: Wolffiella welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's wolfberry, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by follicles containing numerous seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
